questions.question_text: State the difference between RAM and ROM. [1]
questions.answer_text: RAM is volatile memory used for temporary storage; ROM is non-volatile and stores permanent instructions.
A bit is the smallest unit of data in computing, representing a binary value of 0 or 1.

questions.question_text: State one advantage of using solid-state drives over hard disk drives. [1]
questions.answer_text: Solid-state drives are faster and have no moving parts, making them more durable.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of an operating system? [1]
questions.answer_text: An operating system manages hardware and software resources and provides services for programs.

questions.question_text: State the difference between a compiler and an interpreter. [1]
questions.answer_text: A compiler translates the whole program before execution; an interpreter translates line by line during execution.
An algorithm is a step-by-step set of instructions designed to solve a specific problem.

questions.question_text: State one reason why hexadecimal is used in computing. [1]
questions.answer_text: Hexadecimal is more compact and easier to read than binary for representing large values.

questions.question_text: What is the function of the control unit in a CPU? [1]
questions.answer_text: The control unit directs the flow of data and instructions within the CPU.

questions.question_text: State the difference between lossless and lossy compression. [1]
questions.answer_text: Lossless compression retains all original data; lossy compression removes some data to reduce file size.
A protocol is a set of rules that govern data communication between devices.
